p: kycDAO JS/TS SDK canonical URL: https://github.com/kycdao/kycdao-js-sdk

kycDAO creates a shared bridge of on-chain verification proofs that enable web3 service providers to deliver products to trusted users across ecosystems and blockchains. Non-transferable NFTs are minted as proof-of-verifications (no PII) to enable compliant composability while eliminating data duplication. kycNFTs are the base for a permissionless identity and serve as a unique web3 version of a twitter tick.
The SDK can be used two ways:
by embedding the browser compatible JavaScript code directly into HTML (with the help of a CDN service like jsDelivr)
When using the NPM package make sure to install the peer dependencies as well.
You can always find all versions and generate script tags for them at https://www.jsdelivr.com/package/npm/@kycdao/kycdao-sdk

The SDK has an asynchronous initializer method which returns the SDK object as one of its fields which can be used to acccess the SDK methods. For details on the configuration options check out the API reference.
An example repository using the embedded method: https://github.com/kycdao/sdk-example

The main focus of this sequence diagram is to provide a better understanding on the required interaction between the SDK and the integrating host page. Communication between our services and certain third party providers are intentionally not detailed.
Union type of string values of Blockchains.
Union type of string values of BlockchainNetworks.
Possible events handled by the SDK during initialization after a redirect.
Ƭ VerificationStasusByType: Partial< Record< VerificationType, boolean>>
Type for representing verified status for possible verification types with a boolean flag.
Union type of string values of VerificationTypes.
The list of countries recognized by the SDK with their respective ISO codes.
This class provides the connection to a kycDAO server, initiates flows with third party providers (for wallet connection, verification, etc.) and handles responses and redirects from them.
Returns the base URL of the configured kycDAO server.
Returns the connected wallet if there is any.
Returns if there is a user currently logged in.
Returns the current status of the SDK.
Returns if there is a wallet currently connected.
▸ checkVerificationStatus(): Promise< Partial< Record< AccreditedInvestor| KYC, boolean>>>
This method can be used to poll the backend, refreshing the user session and checking for the verification status.
Promise< Partial< Record< AccreditedInvestor| KYC, boolean>>>
Initiates wallet connection with a third party wallet provider.

Disconnects the currently connected wallet (from the current domain). Only works with NEAR wallets, can be used before KycDao.connectWallet to allow connecting a new NEAR wallet instead of a previously connected one.
Returns the URL of the identicon that will be saved into the next minted NFT for the current user. The URL is static and always returns the currently generated image for the user.
A test method to check configuration and kycDAO server access.
Checks on chain if the provided (or the currently connected) wallet has a valid kycNFT.
remarks IMPORTANT! The result of this request can be manipulated on the client side so make sure to verify this on the server side as well.
This method generates a new identicon for the user.
remark The image URL is static so it has to be force-reloaded after the change.
This method creates a session and user for the connected wallet, or log them in. A session cookie will be saved in the browser.

remarks Ideally this method shouldn't be called repeatedly in quick succession (before the previous call got resolved) because in case of new wallets/users the registration logic will be triggered multiple times and every call after the first one will result in an error. For the same reason, error handling is advised.

This step updates the user based on the MintingData provided and checks if the user is eligible to mint a token. Then calls the server to authorize minting for the current wallet and waits for the transaction to succeed (but max about 2 minutes). After an authorization code is acquired it initiates the minting.
This method updates the user with data provided in VerificationData and then starts a verification flow with the approrpiate third party provider.
Connect to a kycDAO server and initialize the SDK using the provided configuration.
Collection of available environment types for initializing the SDK.

Demo mode is intended to be more conveninet for demonstrating (and also developing) the integration with kycDAO. Compared to the test mode it removes some verification and minting restrictions so the same wallet/user can be used multiple times to start/finish the flows.
Test mode is intended to behave the same way as production but using test/sandbox servers and services of third party providers.
Collection of supported verification low types.
Representation of a blockchain wallet with the implemented blockchain protocol included.
• blockchainNetwork: EthereumGoerli| EthereumMainnet| PolygonMainnet| PolygonMumbai| NearTestnet| NearMainnet
Alphanumeric, 2 character ISO code of the country.
The result of the SDK initialization process.
The instance of the initialized KycDao class.
The type of RedirectEvent that was detected and handled during the initialization, if there was one.
The current status of the SDK.
Data required by kycDAO to initiate NFT minting.
Was the disclaimer about the kycDAO NFTs accepted by the user? Has to be true or the minting request will fail.

The user has to be verified for this verification type to be able to have a token minted. The KycDao.checkVerificationStatus method can be used to query/poll the kycDao server and check for the verification status. The verification type determines which smart contract will be used for the minting. It defaults to KYC when left undefined for backward compatibility reasons.
• blockchainNetwork: EthereumGoerli| EthereumMainnet| PolygonMainnet| PolygonMumbai| NearTestnet| NearMainnet
The wallet to check for a valid kycDAO NFT. If undefined the current connected wallet will be used.
A custom RPC endpoint URL to use for the check instead of the default one.
Options related to the Persona verification flow.
Allows specifying additional origins for CSP purposes. Values should include both protocol and host (e.g. https://withpersona.com).

This is REQUIRED when the page that embeds the Persona widget is itself embedded in another page as an iframe. The value should be an array of origins for ALL iframes that are ancestors of the Persona iframe.
Allows specifying a custom target for window.postMessage from the Persona app, which defaults to the iframe origin.
This is REQUIRED when the page that embeds the Persona widget is itself embedded in another page as an iframe. The value should be the origin where the Persona SDK is mounted.
This callback is called when an user cancels the inquiry flow before completion.
This callback is called when the inquiry has completed the inquiry flow and the user clicks on the complete button to close the flow.
This callback is called in response to errors in the inquiry flow that prevent the inquiry flow from being usable. These generally occur on initial load.
Configuration parameters required for instantiating the SDK object.
CURRENTLY UNUSED Optional API key used to identify the client initializing the SDK.
The base API URL of the kycDAO server to connect to. For integration/testing use https://staging.kycdao.xyz For production use https://kycdao.xyz

Switch for enabling demo mode. Demo mode is intended to be more conveninet for demonstrating (and also developing) the integration with kycDAO. It removes some verification and minting restrictions so the same wallet/user can be used multiple times to start/finish the flows.
• Optional enabledBlockchainNetworks: ( EthereumGoerli| EthereumMainnet| PolygonMainnet| PolygonMumbai| NearTestnet| NearMainnet)[]

List of BlockchainNetworks to be available to use. This can influence what third party providers will get initialized. As a rule of thumb test networks will be available when connecting to a kycDAO test server and main networks when connecting to the kycDAO production server (see baseUrl).
If undefined, all networks available on the configured kycDAO server will be enabled.
List of VerificationTypes to be available to use. This can influence what third party providers will get initialized.
deprecated since version 0.1.3, use demoMode switch instead.
Environment type used for influencing the behavior of the SDK.

If there are any EVM networks enabled this object will be used as the EVM provider (i.e.: MetaMask or anything EIP-1193, EIP-2255 compatible). Historically, EVM providers have been made available as the window.ethereum object in web browsers, but this convention is not part of the mentioned specifications. Existance of required methods/fields will be verified during SDK initialization.
The current status of the SDK.
• availableBlockchainNetworks: ( EthereumGoerli| EthereumMainnet| PolygonMainnet| PolygonMumbai| NearTestnet| NearMainnet)[]
List of BlockchainNetworks currently available to use. See SdkConfiguration.enabledBlockchainNetworks
List of VerificationTypes currently available to use. See SdkConfiguration.enabledVerificationTypes
The base API URL of the kycDAO server currently used by the SDK.
A flag indicating if demo mode is turned on or not. See SdkConfiguration.demoMode
A flag indicating if an EVM provider is configured and ready to use or not. See SdkConfiguration.evmProvider
• nearNetworkConnected: null| EthereumGoerli| EthereumMainnet| PolygonMainnet| PolygonMumbai| NearTestnet| NearMainnet
The blockchain network currently used by the SDK, null if there is none. This value will depend on the SdkConfiguration provided and the available networks on the connected kycDAO server.
If the server status is OK it contains the current server datetime in ISO 8601 format. If it isn't it contains an error message.
Signals if the server is available and accesible or not.
The base API URL of the connected kycDAO server.
Data required by kycDAO to initiate a verification flow.
Was the email address already confirmed?
Is the user a legal entity or not?
Country of tax residency. Either the English name or the ISO code of a country from the Countries list.
Were the kycDAO legal documents accepted by the user? Has to be true or verification requests will fail.
The selected verification type from enabledVerificationTypes specified in SdkConfiguration during initialization.
Options related to various verification providers.
